raw_text:
Ferguson puts faith in youngsters
 
 Manchester United manager Sir Alex Ferguson said he has no regrets after his second-string side lost 3-0 away at Fenerbahce in the Champions League.
 
 Ferguson said: "The good thing about being manager is that you are in control of which team to pick. "I care about United, that's important, so while I am disappointed at the result I am not at the team I selected. "This game was important for the young lads. They will remember it and next time they come they will be better." Ferguson admitted his side were well-beaten by the Turks, a result which meant they finished second in Group D behind Lyon. He added: "They'll know not to play like that again. We showed a lack of strength. But I have no complaints about the scoreline. "In the second half we had some good moments in attack. And in that situation, you have to take one chance. "But we didn't do that, so the game just petered out for us. "I didn't think it made much difference whether we won the group or finished second and I still don't. "We could get Inter, AC Milan and Juventus but Bayern, Barcelona and Real Madrid were among the runners-up. All we can do is let fate decide how it works out."
llama3.2:1b: Manchester United manager Sir Alex Ferguson admitted that his side's loss to Fenerbahce in the Champions League was disappointing, but expressed no regrets about selecting a second-string team.
Despite the result, he praised the young players for remembering the game and improving next time around.
Ferguson also stated that he would not change his approach given the situation, saying "We could get Inter, AC Milan and Juventus but Bayern, Barcelona and Real Madrid were among the runners-up".
llama3.2:3b: Sir Alex Ferguson expressed no regrets over Manchester United's 3-0 loss to Fenerbahce in the Champions League, citing his selection of the second-string team as a positive.
He praised the young players for their experience and encouraged them to learn from the defeat, saying they will be better next time around.
gemma2:2b: Sir Alex Ferguson believes his understudy team lost to Fenerbahce in the Champions League.
He acknowledges their defeat as a learning experience for young players, but remains confident in their future.
Though disappointed with the loss, he highlights that Manchester United still has potential and can compete against top teams.
qwen2.5:0.5b: Manchester United manager Sir Alex Ferguson is disappointed with his side's loss to Fenerbahce in the Champions League, as he says he prioritizes the team over individual performance.
He notes that being a manager is about selecting teams and is important for United as well, so while he feels the result was disappointing, he doesn't regret the selection made.
Ferguson also mentions that his side's poor performance led to them finishing second in Group D behind Lyon.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Manchester United manager Sir Alex Ferguson expresses disappointment with a 3-0 Champions League loss to Fenerbahce despite being in control of selecting his team.
He acknowledges that young players learned from the experience but criticizes their performance and lack of strength, leading to a poor result.
Despite the loss, he remains content with the scoreline and believes it teaches them not to repeat past mistakes.
Ferguson downplays concerns about fate deciding the outcome after securing spots in the group stage for other teams.
qwen2.5:3b: Ferguson says he has no regrets after his Manchester United's second-string side lost 3-0 to Fenerbahce in a Champions League match.
He emphasizes caring about the club, focusing on improving young players rather than winning or losing.
Ferguson acknowledges that while well-beaten, his team showed potential and will benefit from this experience.
He did not complain about the scoreline and believes the team can improve.
opencoder:1.5b: He had no regrets after losing 3-0 against Fenerbahce in the Champions League.
The team Fenerbahce won, which means they finished second in Group D behind Lyon.
They'll remember this game and next time they come, they will be better.
They showed a lack of strength, but I have no complaints about the scoreline.
In the second half, we had good moments in attack, but that didn't change the situation.

I didn't think it made much difference whether we won the group or finished second, and finally, we could get Inter, AC Milan and Juventus among the runners-up, with all we can do is let fate decide how things work out.
deepseek-r1:1.5b: Ferguson has faith in young players after their recent Champions League loss against Fenerbahce 3-0, emphasizing their story and growth.
He acknowledged the team's hard-fought outcome but emphasized learning from past mistakes now.
The team showed resilience and potential with positive moments, though they didn't capitalize on chances.
Despite not gaining much, he remains unchanged about their fate.
tinyllama:1.1b: Fergunoson reiterates his conviction that young players are capable of performing well in matches.
Despite losing by a single goal, Ferguzon acknowledges the team's deficiencies and emphasizes that they will learn from the result.
Manchester United finished second in their Group D, having secured victory against FC Fenerbahce, but was unable to prevent an eventual loss.
Despite not performing well during matches, Ferguzon remains optimistic about his squad's potential.
The team's fate ultimately rested on its ability to perform under the pressure of a particular match, with Bayern Munich, Barcelona, Real Madrid and Inter Milan among the possible runners-up.
tinydolphin:1.1b: Sir Alex Ferguson of Manchester United has been discussing his team's performance in the Champions League match against Fenerbahçe.
The game saw the young players, mostly from Manchester United's second-string side, make their debut for the first time.
Despite losing 3-0 away, Ferguson highlighted the importance of playing young players and praised the efforts of these youngsters to make a mark in the football world.
phi:2.7b: Manchester United manager Sir Alex Ferguson said he has no regrets after his second-string side lost 3-0 away at Fenerbahce in the Champions League.
He cares about United but admitted his team lacked strength and didn't take a chance to attack in the second half, resulting in their loss.
However, he is not unhappy with the scoreline and believes they have good moments in attack.
Ferguson said his side finished second in Group D, just behind Lyon.
orca-mini:3b: Ferguson puts faith in youngsters after second-string defeat
hermes3:3b: Ferguson trusts young players after Champions League loss.
stablelm-zephyr:3b: Manchester United manager Sir Alex Ferguson expressed disappointment in his team's 3-0 loss to Fenerbahce in a Champions League match but stood by his decision to give young players opportunities.
He acknowledged the defeat and mentioned that his side showed a lack of strength.
Despite potential matches against Inter, AC Milan, and Juventus, Ferguson stated that he doesn't regret the outcome as long as his team continues to learn and improve from such experiences.

While disappointed with the result, he believed the match would help them improve.
Ferguson acknowledged his team was well-beaten and lacked strength but had no complaints about the scoreline.
He noted some good attacking moments in the second half but lamented missed chances.
Finishing second in Group D behind Lyon did not concern him, as strong opponents awaited regardless of their position.
stablelm2:1.6b: Manchester United manager Alex Ferguson is confident in young players after his team lost 3-0 to Fenerbahce in the Champions League.
Despite being disappointed with the result, he praised the young lads for learning from their mistake and promising improvement next time.
The match was important for the youngsters and they acknowledged the need to improve performance.
Ferguson admitted his side was weak but praised Lyon's performance finishing second in Group D. He didn: "They'll know not to play like that again.
We showed a lack of strength."
In conclusion, he did not mind if United won or finished second as long as they progressed.
granite3.1-dense:2b: Sir Alex Ferguson, Manchester United's manager, expressed no regrets over his team's 3-0 defeat to Fenerbahce in the Champions League, as he had selected the second string.
He emphasized that this loss was crucial for the young players, who will learn from the experience and improve next time.
Despite acknowledging United's poor performance and a lack of strength, Ferguson maintained satisfaction with the scoreline, citing some promising attacking moments in the second half.
He believed the group position didn't significantly impact their progression, as they could have faced stronger opponents like Inter, AC Milan, or Juventus.
Ultimately, Ferguson left the outcome to fate.
